1.text: To the chief Musician, Altaschith, A Psalm or Song of Asaph.  Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.

2.text: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.

3.text: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.

4.text: I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:

5.text: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.

6.text: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.

7.text: But God is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

8.text: For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring them out, and drink them.

9.text: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

10.text: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
